talk.author: did:plc:vzwe4zzwxpzvwsf42fodzuqk
talk.utter: Why?

talk.author: did:plc:v7o5bvq7r6wwpprapzgprd6i
talk.utter:
It usually points to two things: that I can't stand for:
1) Misogyny/ internalized misogyny
2) A tendency to avoid confronting and managing one's own insecurities, opting instead to villainize and dehumanize others bc of their personal choices.

talk.author: did:plc:vzwe4zzwxpzvwsf42fodzuqk
talk.utter:
Do you see any redeeming value in slut shaming for reasons other than those two purposes?

Like what if you genuinely don't like sluts and the way they behave/how that affects society?

talk.author: did:plc:vzwe4zzwxpzvwsf42fodzuqk
talk.utter:
Do you see any redeeming value in slut shaming for reasons other than those two purposes?

Like what if you genuinely don't like sluts and the way they behave/how that affects society?

talk.author: did:plc:v7o5bvq7r6wwpprapzgprd6i
talk.utter:
Redeeming value? No.

If a person has a problem with society, they should address whatever aspect of society has become an issue. Whatever it is, I bet more than body counts and sexual preferences are contributing to it.

talk.author: did:plc:vzwe4zzwxpzvwsf42fodzuqk
talk.utter:
Interesting. In male society we don't like thieves, e.g. So niggaz that steal from the fam get clowned on. "Thief shaming", you could call it.

I think everyone agrees that stealing from others is bad for society, so thief shaming is good for society. I contend that there are ppl who feel that way

talk.author: did:plc:vzwe4zzwxpzvwsf42fodzuqk
talk.utter:
About sluts too. To imply that ones choice in sexual partners has no effect on society is quite a position, one that I think lacks merit. Love and relationships cause trauma and social damage from lovers quarrels and other things all the time.

Sluts are people who have lots of unattached sex, which

talk.author: did:plc:vzwe4zzwxpzvwsf42fodzuqk
talk.utter: Which dramatically increases the incidences of these events This is why men particularly did not like Sluts even tho we still deal with them. I think there is value in policing behavior socially that has a social impact on others, which I contend is the origin of slut shaming, giving it social value

talk.author: did:plc:vzwe4zzwxpzvwsf42fodzuqk
talk.utter: Thoughts?

talk.author: did:plc:vzwe4zzwxpzvwsf42fodzuqk
talk.utter: Thoughts?

talk.author: did:plc:v7o5bvq7r6wwpprapzgprd6i
talk.utter:
Policing people's sexual habits when they have nothing to do with you is simply insecurity. 

People will try to sign reasons to it, but those reasons are never exclusively due to sex. It's just what some choose to focus on.

talk.author: did:plc:vzwe4zzwxpzvwsf42fodzuqk
talk.utter:
I disagree. Bestiality for example. Everyone benefits from policing that behavior down to zero.

One's sexual behavior affects others often in ways that are MORE damaging than other things. STDS, broken homes, etc. Policing sexual behavior collectively therefore has potential social benefit

talk.author: did:plc:v7o5bvq7r6wwpprapzgprd6i
talk.utter:
Oh. Lover's quarrels? Those can happen regardless of someone's sexual habits. 

I've seen abstinent couples get into it over various issues.

talk.utter: Right, just like a pigeon can fly down and steal your chipotle. But that'll happen a lot more if you surround yourself with pigeons than if not...slutty women DRAMATICALLY increase societal conflicts...
